body_html: I can't speak to the Java API issues—@ashankar would know the answers here—but the tf.reduce_join() operation will concatenate a tf.string tensor along one or more dimensions (separated by an optional separator string), and I think it has the functionality you're looking for.
body_text: I can't speak to the Java API issues—@ashankar would know the answers here—but the tf.reduce_join() operation will concatenate a tf.string tensor along one or more dimensions (separated by an optional separator string), and I think it has the functionality you're looking for.
body: I can't speak to the Java API issues—@ashankar would know the answers here—but the [`tf.reduce_join()`](https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/reduce_join) operation will concatenate a `tf.string` tensor along one or more dimensions (separated by an optional separator string), and I think it has the functionality you're looking for.
